action.action-desc: Mr. Coble (for himself, Mr. Watt, Mr. Holding, and Mr. Thompson of Mississippi) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 28, United States Code, to modify the composition of the southern judicial district of Mississippi to improve judicial efficiency, and for other purposes.

section.header: Realignment of southern judicial district of Mississippi
section.text: Section 104(b) of title 28, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:

subsection.text: The southern district comprises four divisions.

paragraph.text: The Northern Division comprises the counties of Copiah, Hinds, Holmes, Issaquena, Kemper, Lauderdale, Leake, Madison, Neshoba, Newton, Noxubee, Rankin, Scott, Simpson, Sharkey, Smith, Warren, and Yazoo.

subsection.continuation-text: Court for the Northern Division shall be held at Jackson.

paragraph.text: The Southern Division comprises the counties of George, Greene, Hancock, Harrison, Jackson, Pearl River, and Stone.

subsection.continuation-text: Court for the Southern Division shall be held at Gulfport.

paragraph.text: The Eastern Division comprises the counties of Clarke, Covington, Forrest, Jasper, Jefferson Davis, Jones, Lamar, Lawrence, Marion, Perry, Wayne, and Walthall.

subsection.continuation-text: Court for the Eastern Division shall be held at Hattiesburg.

paragraph.text: The Western Division comprises the counties of Adams, Amite, Claiborne, Franklin, Jefferson, Lincoln, Pike, and Wilkinson.

subsection.continuation-text: Court for the Western Division shall be held at Natchez.

section.text: This Act and the amendment made by this Act shall take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.
